items.title: eBay makes it easier to find fast-shipping items and local listings
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- eBay updated its platform to facilitate finding fast-shipping items and local listings using AI and new search item cards.
- Items with fast delivery now display estimated delivery ranges, and a new “shipping and pickup” filter has been introduced.
- eBay's AI improvements help provide accurate shipping estimates by considering location proximity, shipping service, seller history, and real-time data.
- A “Top-Service” badge will help customers identify high-quality items with attributes like fast shipping and free returns.
- These updates aim to improve user experience and competitiveness against e-commerce rivals like Amazon and Etsy.

items.title: FBI says North Korea ‘responsible’ for $1.4 billion Bybit heist
items.summary:
- The FBI attributes the Bybit hack, resulting in a theft of over $1.4 billion in Ethereum, to the North Korean government.
- The hack was linked to a group identified as TraderTraitor.
- Bybit confirmed the heist on February 21, claiming 401,346 Ethereum was stolen.
- The FBI issued a public advisory warning that the assets might be laundered and converted to fiat currency.
- Bybit has launched a $140 million bounty to track the stolen funds.

items.title: 4 days left to save up to $325 at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- You have four days to save up to $325 on tickets for [TechCrunch Sessions: AI](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-sessions-ai/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcsessionsai&utm_content=post_seb4days_02272025&promo=post_seb4days_02272025&display=), ending on March 2 at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- The event will take place on June 5 at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall, featuring over 1,200 AI leaders and tech enthusiasts.
- Key speakers include Oliver Cameron, CEO of Odyssey, and other prominent figures in the AI industry. Participants can explore cutting-edge AI advancements and network with industry leaders.

items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Just 2 days left to save up to $1,130
items.summary:
• Limited time offer: Save up to $1,130 on individual tickets and 30% on group tickets for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.
• Event dates: October 27-29, 2025, at Moscone West, San Francisco.
• Over 10,000 tech leaders expected, with 250+ sessions and insights from 200+ experts.
• Highlight: Startup Battlefield competition with a $100,000 prize.
• Registration deadline: Prices increase after February 28 at 11:59 p.m. PT.

items.title: Just Move In raises $8M Series A for its home setup service
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- Just Move In raised an $8M Series A funding round led by Eos Ventures for its home setup services.
- The company aims to streamline the process of setting up home services such as utilities and insurance through a single platform.
- Just Move In currently manages over 300,000 moves in the UK, targeting to process over 400,000 home moves in 2025.
- The strategic backing will allow expansion into embedded financial services, simplifying access to credit and insurance products.
- The startup plans to expand its services into Europe in the future.

items.title: Stripe finalizes tender sale at a $91.5B valuation, says payment volumes grew to $1.4T in 2024
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Stripe confirms a tender offer for employees to sell shares at a valuation of $91.5 billion.
- Payment volume grew to $1.4 trillion in 2024, a 38% increase from the previous year.
- The tender offer follows a previous valuation of $70 billion a year ago but falls short of the $95 billion high in 2021.
- Stripe utilized by half of Fortune 100 companies, highlighting its growth from a startup to major enterprise player.
- The offer primarily involves existing investors, which include notable names like Elon Musk and Salesforce.
- Earlier reports indicated the tender offer was in the works earlier this month.

items.title: IBM closes $6.4B HashiCorp acquisition
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- IBM has finalized its acquisition of HashiCorp for $6.4 billion, following approval from the U.K. and U.S. regulators.
- HashiCorp is known for Terraform, an infrastructure management tool that recently switched to a proprietary license.
- IBM plans to use HashiCorp’s technology to enhance its hybrid cloud platform, which has seen growth amidst rising demand for automated cloud infrastructure.
- This acquisition follows significant IBM acquisitions, including Red Hat and Apptio, as it aims to strengthen its hybrid cloud offerings.

items.title: Amazon debuts Ocelot, its first quantum computing chip
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) introduces Ocelot, its first quantum computing chip on February 27, 2025.
- This launch positions AWS alongside competitors Microsoft and Google, who have also released quantum chips.
- Ocelot was developed with the California Institute of Technology and aims to reduce error-correction costs by up to 90%.
- Quantum computing utilizes qubits for faster calculations and has applications in drug discovery, cryptography, and artificial intelligence.
- AWS's quantum hardware director, Oskar Painter, emphasizes the importance of practical fault-tolerant quantum computers in real-world applications.

items.title: Unique, a Swiss AI platform for finance, raises $30M
items.author: Manuel Grenacher, Michelle Heppler, Andreas Hauri
items.summary:
- Unique, a Swiss startup, raised $30 million in Series A funding led by DN Capital and CommerzVentures.
- The company focuses on 'agentic AI' for financial services, automating workflows in research and compliance.
- Unique offers AI agents for investment research and due diligence, catering to banks and financial institutions.
- Plans to expand internationally, particularly in the U.S., with a total of $53 million raised so far.

items.title: Taktile helps fintechs build automated decision-making workflows
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Taktile, founded by Maximilian Eber and Maik Taro Wehmeyer, aims to make financial decision-making processes more adaptable and user-friendly.
- The platform allows users to create and manage automated decision-making workflows in fintech, with features for monitoring and A/B testing.
- Taktile raised $54 million in Series B funding to enhance product development and expand its sales team, bringing total funding to $79 million.

items.title: Instagram may spin off Reels into a separate app
items.summary:
- Meta is considering launching a standalone app for short-form videos, reportedly code-named Project Ray.
- The app aims to enhance recommendations and feature more three-minute videos for U.S. users.
- This move comes after Instagram faced criticism for its mixed feed of photos and videos, and follows their recent release of a video editing app called Edits.

items.title: Google Gemini: Everything You Need to Know About the Generative AI Models
items.summary:
- Google introduced Gemini, its new generative AI model family, developed by DeepMind and Google Research.
- Gemini consists of four models: Gemini Ultra, Pro, Flash, and Nano, with multimodal capabilities for text, audio, images, and videos.
- Gemini includes apps that interface with its models, available on web and mobile, replacing existing Google Assistant functionalities.
- Advanced features available to users include enhanced context memory for conversations and integration into Google Workspace applications.
- Users can create custom chatbots (Gems) and interact with Gemini across various Google services like Gmail and Drive.

items.title: Apple iPhone 16e review: An A18 chip and Apple Intelligence for $599
items.summary:
- Apple launched the $599 iPhone 16e without a major event, announced via a press release.
- The phone features a familiar design, resembling the iPhone 13 and 14, with an A18 chip and custom C1 modem.
- It drops the price compared to the iPhone 16 while providing future-proofing with longer support for the A18 chip and access to Apple Intelligence, a generative AI platform.
- The iPhone 16e sports a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display but lacks the MagSafe connector and Dynamic Island found in higher models.
- It offers 26 hours of battery life and is equipped with a single 48-megapixel rear camera that uses computational photography to enhance image quality.
- Its pricing strategy is aimed at competing in key markets like China and India, though it faces stiff competition from local manufacturers.

items.title: Europe’s Relay pulls in $35M Series A after applying Asia’s model to delivery
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- Europe’s Relay raised $35 million in Series A funding led by Plural, with participation from Project A and Prologis Ventures.
- The company utilizes an asset-free delivery model inspired by Asian e-commerce, using mini-depots and e-bikes to reduce carbon emissions and enhance efficiency.
- Relay’s technology improves proof-of-delivery compliance by 82% through computer vision, addressing delivery quality and reducing retailer claims.
- The platform is in use by numerous companies, including Vinted, TikTok, and various U.K. retailers, and is expanding across major U.K. cities.

items.title: Lonestar and Phison’s data center infrastructure is headed to the moon
Commercetools, a pioneer in ‘headless commerce’, lays off dozens of staff
items.summary:
- Commercetools has laid off around 10% of its staff, totaling more than 70 employees.
- The layoffs are due to the company failing to meet its sales growth targets after a period of rapid expansion during the pandemic.
- CEO Andrew Burton cited ambitious goals not aligning with macro-economic realities and changing market dynamics as reasons for restructuring.
- The company is also experiencing executive changes, including the departure of the CFO and CRO.
- Commercetools, founded in 2006, originally saw significant growth after being spun out from retail giant REWE in 2019.

items.title: Shop Circle raises $60M to encircle e-commerce with an app suite
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- Shop Circle has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Nextalia Ventures to expand its app suite for e-commerce.
- The company completed the acquisition of Aiden, an AI-powered selling software used by major brands like LG and Prenatal.
- Shop Circle reported a 110% year-on-year revenue increase and has been profitable for the past two years, focusing on commerce-centric products and generative AI integration.
- CEO Luca Cartechini highlighted the company's unique position in providing all solutions under one platform, integrating deeply with Shopify.
- This funding round follows a previous raise of $120 million in 2023 led by other investors.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang shrugs off DeepSeek as sales soar
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang remains optimistic about the company's future, downplaying the impact of DeepSeek on sales during a recent earnings call.
- Huang highlighted the R1 model from DeepSeek as an 'excellent innovation' that increases demand for Nvidia's computing resources.
- Nvidia reported a record revenue of $39.3 billion and expects to reach approximately $43 billion in the next quarter, with data center sales nearly doubling to $115 billion in 2024.

items.title: Meta’s Oversight Board is reviewing the company’s new hate speech policies
items.summary:
- Meta’s Oversight Board is reviewing changes to hate speech policies rolled out by CEO Mark Zuckerberg.
- The review follows an overhaul of content moderation policies announced in January 2025, aimed at allowing 'more speech' on platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and Threads.
- The new changes include rolling back protections for immigrants and LGBTQ users.
- The Oversight Board has four open cases related to hateful speech and will use these to assess Meta's new policies.
- Historically, Meta has a mixed record in adhering to the Oversight Board’s recommendations regarding general policy changes, though it must follow the board's decisions on specific posts.

items.title: With Alexa+, Amazon makes an intriguing play in the consumer agent space
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon introduced Alexa+, an enhanced version of its voice assistant, capable of handling various tasks autonomously.
- Alexa+ will leverage generative AI and can integrate with first- and third-party applications for improved user experiences.
- The launch is scheduled for preview next month, and the service will be free for Prime subscribers, encouraging widespread adoption.
- Key features include grocery shopping, ordering deliveries, booking appointments, and setting reminders using multiple sources.
- Amazon aims to position Alexa+ as a leader in the consumer agent space, amidst competition from other AI developers, while overcoming existing AI limitations and previous service issues.

items.title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Expand DOGE’s Spending Review Powers
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Trump administration issues a new executive order to expand DOGE’s review powers.
- DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency) is required to create a centralized system in federal agencies to record contract and grant awards.
- Agency employees must provide written justifications for contract payments and for non-essential travel expenses.
- DOGE's expansion follows a recent email to federal employees asking for weekly work accomplishments with potential termination for non-compliance.
- DOGE was established under an earlier executive order on January 20, aiming for more efficient federal spending oversight.

items.title: a16z hires former Republican congressman Patrick McHenry as advisor
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Former North Carolina congressman Patrick McHenry has joined VC firm Andreessen Horowitz as a senior advisor.
- His role will involve advocating for startups with policymakers.
- McHenry served 20 years in Congress, notably as chairman of the House Financial Services Committee.
- a16z has recently been increasing its involvement in policy and government, raising $7.6 billion for crypto/web3 tech.

items.title: Maternity clinic Millie nabs $12M Series A from an all-star, all female class of VCs
items.author: Anu Sharma, Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Millie, a California-based maternity clinic, raised $12 million in Series A funding.
- Investors include RH Capital, TMV, and Melinda French Gates' Pivotal Ventures.
- Founded by Anu Sharma, the clinic aims to provide comprehensive maternity and gynecology care, inspired by Sharma's personal birth experience.
- Millie combines in-person care with virtual visits and a proprietary app, using AI-enabled workflows.
- The company has raised nearly $19 million to date and plans to expand its footprint across California and enhance technology services.

items.title: Avride’s sidewalk delivery bots land in Japan
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary:
- Avride sidewalk bots to deliver restaurant orders and groceries in central Tokyo via a partnership with Rakuten.
- Launch includes 10 robots, with plans to expand, following certification completed in Japan.
- Company has existing operations in Seoul and Ohio State University with over 100 delivery bots, including deals with Uber and Grubhub.

items.title: These alternatives to popular apps can help reclaim your online life from billionaires and surveillance
items.summary:
- Control of personal data is becoming vital as app ownership consolidates.
- Alternatives exist to popular apps that prioritize privacy and security.
- Options include Wallabag for saving articles, Signal for encrypted messaging, and Nextcloud as a self-hosted storage solution.
- Bitwarden serves as a secure password manager, while Joplin and Notesnook offer encrypted note-taking.
- LibreOffice is a private alternative to Microsoft Office.
- Ente.io provides secured photo storage.
- Setting up a Pi-hole helps to block ads across devices.
- Creating a personal encrypted VPN enhances online privacy.

items.title: Here are all the tech companies rolling back DEI or still committed to it — so far
items.summary:
- Companies in the U.S. are cutting DEI programs due to legal and political pressures from the Trump administration.
- Attorney General Pam Bondi instructed the Department of Justice to target DEI programs in companies receiving federal funds.
- Trump signed an executive order banning DEI initiatives in the federal government, supported by Elon Musk.
- Major corporations like McDonalds, Harley Davidson, and Goldman Sachs are reducing or eliminating DEI policies.
- Companies such as Apple and JPMorgan are maintaining their commitment to diversity initiatives.
- Google is not renewing diversity hiring targets and will review existing DEI initiatives to comply with new regulations.
- Meta is significantly scaling back its DEI efforts and has eliminated its DEI team.
- Many companies are scrubbing mentions of DEI from official filings and public documents.

items.title: Inception emerges from stealth with a new type of AI model
items.author: Stefano Ermon, Aditya Grover, Volodymyr Kuleshov
items.summary:
- Inception is a Palo Alto-based company founded by Stanford professor Stefano Ermon, focused on a new diffusion-based AI model called DLM.
- Inception's model combines the capabilities of traditional LLMs with faster performance and lower costs.
- The model allows for generating and modifying large blocks of text in parallel, unlike traditional LLMs which are sequential.
- Inception has already secured customers, including Fortune 100 companies, addressing a need for reduced AI latency.
- The company offers an API and various deployment options, claiming its DLMs are up to 10x faster and cost 10x less than traditional LLMs.
- A company spokesperson stated that their models can perform as well as OpenAI’s GPT-4o mini but with greater speed.

items.title: Hacked crypto exchange Bybit offers $140 million bounty to trace stolen funds
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Hackers stole around $1.4 billion in Ethereum from Bybit, the largest crypto heist in history.
- Bybit is offering $140 million in bounties for tracing and freezing the stolen funds.
- CEO Ben Zhou announced the bounty on X, with rewards of 5% for those who trace and 5% for the entity that freezes the funds.
- $4.23 million has already been awarded to bounty hunters.
- The cybersecurity group Lazarus, linked to North Korea, is suspected to be behind the hack.
- Security firms reported that a developer's device at SafeWallet was breached, leading to the hack.

items.title: ElevenLabs is launching its own speech-to-text model
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- ElevenLabs launches its first standalone speech-to-text model called Scribe.
- The model supports over 99 languages, with over 25 offering excellent accuracy (less than 5% word error rate).
- It claims to outperform Google Gemini 2.0 Flash and Whisper Large V3 in benchmark tests.
- Pricing is set at $0.40 per hour of transcribed audio, competitive among rivals.
- Scribe currently works only with pre-recorded audio; a real-time version will be released soon.
- Features include speaker diarization, word-level timestamps, and auto-tagging of sounds.
- The company aims to improve speech detection beyond existing solutions.

items.title: Pixel Watch 3 is getting ‘Loss of Pulse Detection’ in the US in March
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google has received FDA clearance for the Pixel Watch 3’s Loss of Pulse Detection feature, launching in the U.S. by the end of March.
- The feature detects when a user's heart stops beating due to various emergencies and can automatically call for help if the user is unresponsive.
- Loss of Pulse Detection was first launched in the EU in September 2024, now available in 14 countries.
- The feature utilizes AI-driven algorithms, combining pulse check with physiological and motion data.
- Google warns that it may not detect every loss of pulse and is not a substitute for medical care or monitoring.

items.title: Hinge launches a new feature for daters to privately share details with matches
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Hinge launched a new feature called “Match Note” that allows users to privately share information with matches.
- The note is visible to new matches but can be read only once, requiring acknowledgment to begin conversation.
- Designed to support underrepresented groups like LGBTQIA+ and neurodivergent users, allowing them to share sensitive information discreetly.

items.title: Alexa+ can read, summarize and recall lengthy documents
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Amazon introduced Alexa+, a new version of its voice assistant powered by generative AI.
- Users can share documents with Alexa+, allowing it to recall details and answer questions related to those documents.
- Demonstrations showed Alexa+ extracting information from recipes and HOA guidelines, as well as summarizing school emails.

items.title: Amazon Alexa+ can do your grocery shopping, too
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Amazon launches Alexa+, a revamped version of its virtual shopping assistant for grocery shopping.
- The new feature allows users to shop through natural language conversations.
- Works with Amazon Fresh and other grocery partners, including food delivery from Uber Eats.
- Alexa can help build shopping lists and adjust quantities dynamically based on user requests.
- The upgraded Alexa+ will be available in March for $19.99 a month, free for Prime members.

items.title: Alexa+ can do your grocery shopping, too
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Amazon introduces Alexa+, a revamped experience allowing grocery shopping through natural conversations.
- Alexa can assist with shopping using Amazon Fresh or other grocery partners and delivery services like Uber Eats.
- The assistant enables users to build shopping lists via voice commands, adjusting quantities and offering meal suggestions based on preferences.
- The Alexa+ upgrade will be available in March for $19.99 per month, free for Prime members.

items.title: Amazon Alexa+ costs $19.99, free for Prime members
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon’s new Alexa+ launches at $19.99, free for Prime members.
- Early access begins next month in the U.S., with wider rollout in subsequent months.
- Compatible devices include Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21; other devices' support is unclear.
- Introduction of Alexa.com for long-form work and a refreshed mobile app.
- Pricing competitive with other AI chatbots like ChatGPT and Google’s Gemini Advanced.
- Initial expectations were for a price between $5 to $10.

items.title: Alexa+ costs $19.99, free for Amazon Prime members
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon's Alexa+ launch price is $19.99, free for Amazon Prime members.
- Early access begins next month in the U.S., with broader rollout over subsequent months.
- Compatible devices include Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21; support for other devices unclear.
- Introduction of Alexa.com for long-form work and a refreshed mobile app.
- Alexa+ pricing is competitive with ChatGPT and Google's Gemini Advanced, both at $19.99.
- Initial rumors suggested a price between $5 to $10 for a potential trial offer.

items.title: Amazon’s new Alexa+ brings AI-powered ‘Explore’ and ‘Stories’ features for kids
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched two new features for kids: **Explore with Alexa** and **Stories with Alexa**, as part of its new AI-powered Alexa+ assistant.
- The **Explore** feature allows kids to ask questions about various topics, with Alexa providing informative responses.
- In **Stories with Alexa**, kids can prompt Alexa to create stories, enhancing imaginative play.
- Amazon Kids+ subscription is priced at **$5.99/month** for Prime members and **$7.99/month** for non-Prime members, targeting children aged 3-12.

items.title: Amazon says that Alexa+ is ‘model agnostic’
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon unveiled Alexa+, a new version that uses a "model agnostic" system.  
- Alexa+ utilizes Bedrock, Amazon's cloud platform for generative AI, and incorporates both Amazon Nova models and those from Anthropic.  
- It features a new system called "experts" for executing tasks and can interact with thousands of devices and services on day one.  
- Alexa+ can autonomously navigate websites, for instance, it can find and contact repair services.

items.title: Continue Aims to Help Developers Build Custom AI Coding Assistants
items.author: Ty Dunn, Nate Sesti
items.summary:
- Continue is a startup founded in June 2023 aimed at helping developers create customizable AI coding assistants.
- The company has received $3 million in seed funding and has about 23,000 GitHub stars and 11,000 Discord members.
- Their product supports integration with various data platforms and allows developers to create tailored autocomplete and chat experiences in coding environments.
- Continue's launch coincides with a surge in the AI coding assistant market, competing with tools like GitHub Copilot and Google’s Gemini Code Assist.
- The newly launched hub allows developers to create and share custom AI assistants and leverage blocks from verified partners.

items.title: Oliver Cameron discusses competing against incumbents at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI will take place on June 5, 2025, at UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall.
- Panel titled *How to Launch a Product Against Entrenched Incumbents* focuses on strategies for startups competing in the AI sector.
- Oliver Cameron, co-founder of Odyssey and former VP at Cruise, will be one of the panelists.
- The AI sector is experiencing significant investment, with $56 billion allocated by VCs in 2024, but competition is stiff due to incumbent companies' resources.
- Tickets for the event are available at Super Early Bird rates, offering savings up to $325.

items.title: Capim, a Brazilian BNPL startup for dental services, lands a $26.7M Series A
items.author: Marcelo Lutz, Roberto Biselli, Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Capim has raised $26.7 million in Series A funding for its BNPL dental service platform.
- Founded in July 2021, it supports dentists with software solutions and offers flexible payment plans of up to 36 installments.
- The startup aims to enhance its services with POS terminals and AI tools, expanding from 6,000 to over 10,000 dental clinics by year’s end.
- It has helped over 60,000 Brazilians access dental care and reported revenue tripling in 2024 despite still not being profitable.

items.title: Amazon Alexa+ can work with Prime Video and Fire TV to ‘jump to a scene’ in a movie
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Amazon introduces Alexa+ with new features for Prime Video and Fire TV.
- Users can ask Alexa+ to jump to specific scenes in movies by referencing characters or quotes.
- Alexa+ can identify songs from TV show credits even without knowing the title or artist.
- Additional upgrades include smart home device management and voice-controlled routine automation.

items.title: Alexa+ can work with Prime Video and Fire TV to ‘jump to a scene’ in a movie
Cellebrite suspends Serbia as customer after claims police used firm’s tech to plant spyware
Amazon unveils a new and improved Alexa, Alexa+
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Amazon announced upgraded Alexa experience, Alexa+, using generative AI technology.
- Alexa+ can answer personalized questions and notify users about relevant events, utilizing user account information.
- Enhanced capabilities include visual understanding and adapting responses based on environment and tone.
- Integrates with Amazon's smart home ecosystem, and can summarize security footage and interact with user files.
- Marketed as a productivity tool, with future updates to confirm reliability claims.

items.title: YouTube surpasses 1B monthly podcast viewers
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- YouTube announced it has surpassed 1 billion monthly active podcast viewers, competing with Spotify and Apple Podcasts.
- This milestone highlights the growing popularity of video-first formats in the podcast industry.
- Last year, over 400 million hours of podcast content were watched on living room TVs.
- Spotify has responded by investing more in video-first podcasting and paying video hosts based on performance.
- YouTube will implement changes to mid-roll ads from May 12 to improve viewer experience.

items.title: Microsoft finalizes its EU sovereign cloud project
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Microsoft has completed the EU Data Boundary project, allowing Europe-based customers to store and process cloud data in the EU.
- The project began in January 2023 and concluded in February 2025, enabling services like Microsoft 365 and Azure within EU and EFTA regions.
- This initiative supports compliance with European data protection laws such as GDPR.

items.title: Google makes it easier to delete personal info from Search results
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google updates its "Results about you" tool to simplify removal of personal information from Search results.
- Users can now submit removal requests directly from Search results via a new three-dot menu.
- The tool allows for monitoring and deleting personal details like phone numbers and email addresses.
- Users can also request a refresh if content about them has changed on the web but is not reflected in Search results.
- The feature is available in multiple countries including the U.S., U.K., Canada, and India.

items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: 3 days left to save up to $1,130 on passes
items.summary:
- Last chance to save up to $1,130 on passes for [TechCrunch Disrupt 2025](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-disrupt-2025/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=disrupt2025&utm_content=post_seb3days_02262025&promo=post_seb3days_02262025&display=).
- Ticket sales end on February 28 at 11:59 p.m. PT, offering up to 30% off group tickets.
- Conference dates: October 27-29 at Moscone West, San Francisco, celebrating 20 years of TechCrunch Disrupt.
- Attendees can expect 250+ sessions and insights from 200+ experts, covering topics like AI, scaling businesses, and more.
- Featured event: [Startup Battlefield 200](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-disrupt-2025/startup-battlefield/?promo=post_seb3days_02262025&utm_campaign=disrupt2025&utm_content=post_seb3days_02262025&utm_medium=post&utm_source=tc) where startups compete for equity-free prizes.
- Register now for the biggest ticket savings of 2025 before rates increase after February 28.

items.title: 5 days left — save over $300 to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- Only 5 days left to register for [TechCrunch Sessions: AI](https://techcrunch.com/events/tc-sessions-ai/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcsessionsai&utm_content=post_seb5days_02262025&promo=post_seb5days_02262025&display=) with up to $325 in savings.
- Registration ends on March 3 at 11:59 p.m. PT for the event on June 5 at UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall.
- Join 1,200 leaders in AI for talks, breakout sessions, and demos featuring industry pioneers like Oliver Cameron, Kanu Gulati, Jill Chase, and Jae Lee.
